page.title: 10PASTON CHURCHES
page.content: There are two churches in Paston.{ {Paston Church}is over 700 years old,but there was probably a church there in Anglo-Saxon times. The church is built of limestone from a local quarry at Barnack. The rector is Dr.Rimmington. The oldest part of the church is the bottom of the tower and the altar areas. There are three bells in the tower. The other church is{Brookside {Methodist.}This church was opened in September 1976. There are three clubs for younger members; Boy's Brigade, Brownies and Girl Guides. There is also an over sixties club and a keep fit group. There is a Junior Church and a toddlers group on Sundays. The church is a modern brick built building. The minister is Rev.Lakin-Smith.
